subtitle: A dish all the family should like.

method.text: Thread the garlic and chillies onto a skewer. Grill with the red pepper until the skins are black and blistered on all sides. Place in a plastic bag, seal and leave to cool.

Peel the skin from the cooled vegetables. Chop the pepper and chillies discarding the seeds. (For a hotter dressing leave the seeds in the chillies). Place the pepper, chillies, garlic and tomatoes into a blender and puree.
With the motor still running, add half the olive oil, a drop at a time. Pour in remainder in a slow, steady stream until a thick dressing is formed. Season and add lemon juice to taste.
Cook pasta in boiling water until cooked but firm. Drain and cool under running water. Transfer to a large bowl and mix with the cucumber, cheese and dressing.
Stand at room temperature for about 1 hour before serving.

title: Cheshire cheese and pasta salad with spicy tomato dressing
